Correlation Functions¶

Function to perform correlations.

correlate.cross_corr(a, b)¶

Cross-correlation

Calculate the cross correlation of array b against array a.

Parameters

  • a (array) – numpy vector. Reference against which cross correlation is calculated.

  • b (array) – numpy vector. The resulting cross-correlation function will show how b should be shifted to line up with vector a.

Returns

cross-correlation function

Return type

array

correlate.find_shift(a, b)¶

Find offset between a and b.

Find the offset between vector a and b that makes them line up as well as possible.

Parameters

  • a (array) – Reference vector

  • b (array) – Target vector

Returns

the shift needed to be applied to vector b to best match vector a

Return type

float
